text: Four months. Four months is a long time to be away from your kid.
They said summer camp would be good for him. Structure. Fresh air. Other kids.
Still… this place never sat right with me.
That storm on the drive here was terrible…
I hope Oliver isn’t too mad that I’m late.
Continue.
Upon entering the facility, you see a strange masked woman at the reception desk.
Approach the receptionist.
Receptionist: Oh hello dear, you’re quite late.
What are you wearing?
Sorry. The drive was awful.
I’m here to pick up Oliver.
Receptionist: Oh, this? We made them with the kids as a goodbye gift. Such talent, truly!
Return.
Receptionist: Weather has a way of delaying our lives. Still, we like to stay on schedule here.
Return.
Receptionist: … Oliver. Let me see.
Receptionist: Oh. Our records do not show an Oliver enrolled this season.
What? That’s not possible. He’s been here for four months.
Can I speak to a counselor?
Receptionist: Four months? My, that would be quite the oversight.
Receptionist: Still, if he is not registered, he cannot be here.
Can I speak to a counselor?
Leave the conversation.
Receptionist: Staff duties have concluded for the evening.
Receptionist: The lodge is now reserved.
Reserved for what?
Okay, thanks I guess… (leave).
I’m just gonna take a look around, I'll be in and out.
Receptionist: Private matters.
Okay, thanks I guess… (leave).
Receptionist: I am afraid I cannot let you in any further.
Receptionist: As I said before, the lodge has a private reservation. You need to leave.
Leave the conversation.
Receptionist: You cannot enter.
Step back.
Player: There’s something really wrong here. They don’t have him on record. That makes no sense.
Player: I remember signing forms. I remember this place.
Player: Maybe I can wait for her to leave, then try to get through the main door.
TEXT: 30 minutes pass.
The main door is locked.
Continue.
You look around the reception area.
Behind the reception desk, partially hidden, you spot one of the strange masks.
Grab the mask.
Leave it for now.
You pick up the mask from behind the desk.
On the back, you read: "lvl 1 access".
Player: Huh.. Maybe I need this to get through the main door?
Continue.
Wearing the mask, you ring the reception bell.
After a tense moment, you hear a click from the main door. It is now unlocked.
Enter through the main door.
Upper Cultist: Chanting…
What’s going on? (+1 suspicion)
I’m looking for a small boy. (+2 suspicion)
Leave the conversation.
Upper Cultist: … The order has finally reunited…
Player: Uhh, order?
Upper Cultist: They really let anyone in these days… after 3 years, the day of rejuvenation is upon us. We gather to speak to our god…
Player: Oh, right. Yeah.. Rejuvenation and whatnot…
I’m looking for a small boy. (+2 suspicion)
Leave the conversation.
Upper Cultist: A boy..? Can you not hold still until the ceremony. These new members really get on my nerves…
Player: I’m helping out with the event, I’m just a little lost.
Upper Cultist: Well, you forget yourself. You may not speak to me unless you obtain a mask like mine. I have spent years earning the honour to wear this.
Nevermind. Leave.
Upper Cultist: Too anxious to wait, are we? We must all sit tight until the higher order is ready to commence.
Leave the conversation.
Player: I think the receptionist wanted to speak with you.
Upper Cultist: You forget your order! Do not speak to me unless you have reached my status.
Upper Cultist: Sighs. You are new. You will learn. What business might she have with me?
Player: I don’t know but it seemed urgent.
Nevermind. Leave.
Cultist: Hm, you must be new. The masks signify our places among the order. We must follow those with higher authority.
What’s the deal with the masks?
I’m looking for a small boy. (+1 suspicion)
Leave the conversation.
Player: How would I get a higher mask?
Cultist: Foolish! You must show your commitment to the order! But if you’re that desperate, you can read about the masks in the book room.
I’m looking for a small boy. (+1 suspicion)
Leave the conversation.
Cultist: A boy… There are several but I am not supposed to say anything.
Leave the conversation.
Player: I need to find Oliver and get out of here quickly.
Player: This ceremony they keep talking about can’t be good.
Continue.
The upper right door leads into a quiet room lined with shelves.
On the wall hangs a level 2 mask, just out of reach.
Some of the floor boards look old; a few creak loudly underfoot.
Stack books to reach the mask.
Leave the room.
You collect and stack four sturdy books beneath the mask.
Carefully, you climb up, avoiding the worst of the creaky boards, and take the level 2 mask from the wall.
Put on the level 2 mask.
Level 2 NPC: Greetings.
What’s past that door?
How long until the ceremony?
Leave the conversation.
Level 2 NPC: I see. You are making a joke. How comedic!
Level 2 NPC: We all know it is the ritual friend. In due time, we will reap life and share it among our followers.
Player: you’re going to kill someone?
Level 2 NPC: …There is always a balance. You must take life to give life.
How long until the ceremony?
Leave the conversation.

actions.value: find a way through the door

text: Level 2 NPC: We shall commence once our third is ready to begin.
Level 2 NPC: Until then, these doors stay shut.
Return to the other question.
Leave the conversation.
Cult Leader: Finally… After 3 years, we may all embrace an extension of life.
When are we starting?
Nevermind.
Cult Leader: You dare speak to me? You belong to a lower order.
Cult Leader: Sighs. I required someone to give me a knife anyways.
Cult Leader: One cannot commence a proper ceremony without their instrument.
Cult Leader: I believe I left it in the reception room.
Leave the conversation.
You search the reception room and find a knife tucked away.
Player: This can’t be real.. I can’t just give this to them- t-they’re going to hurt Oliver. I need to end this. Now.
Take the knife.

npc: Level1 Cultist (Main Room, with Level 2 Mask)

text: Cultist: Yes?
I need you to make some noise. Chef’s orders to gather everyone here before we begin.
Leave the conversation.
Cultist: Yes sir. Make noise.
Leave.
With the cultists distracted and the knife in hand, you confront the cult leader.
(Gameplay: the player kills the cult leader and takes their mask.)
Take the cult leader’s mask.
Wearing the cult leader’s mask, you enter the ritual room to bring this to an end.
(End of current script segment.)
Continue.
